branding.description: Configuration section for tweaking the branding of the service

policy.description: Configuration related to the OPA policies

telemetry.description: Configuration related to sending monitoring data

upstream_oauth2.description: Configuration related to upstream OAuth providers

anyOf.description: Listen on the specified host and port

host.description:
Host on which to listen.

Defaults to listening on all addresses

address.description: Host and port on which to listen

anyOf.description: Listen on a UNIX domain socket

Accept connections on file descriptors passed by the parent process.

This is useful for grabbing sockets passed by systemd.

See <https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/sd_listen_fds.html>

fd.description: Index of the file descriptor. Note that this is offseted by 3 because of the standard input/output sockets, so setting here a value of `0` will grab the file descriptor `3`

kind.description: Whether the socket is a TCP socket or a UNIX domain socket. Defaults to TCP.

BrandingConfig.description: Configuration section for tweaking the branding of the service

imprint.description: Legal imprint, displayed in the footer in the footer of web pages and emails.

logo_uri.description: Logo displayed in some web pages.

policy_uri.description: Link to a privacy policy, displayed in the footer of web pages and emails. It is also advertised to clients through the `op_policy_uri` OIDC provider metadata.

service_name.description: A human-readable name. Defaults to the server's address.

tos_uri.description: Link to a terms of service document, displayed in the footer of web pages and emails. It is also advertised to clients through the `op_tos_uri` OIDC provider metadata.

displayname.description: Import the displayname of the user.

email.description: Import the email address of the user based on the `email` and `email_verified` claims

localpart.description: Import the localpart of the MXID

subject.description: How to determine the subject of the user

oneOf.description: `none`: No authentication
`client_secret_basic`: `client_id` and `client_secret` used as basic authorization credentials
`client_secret_post`: `client_id` and `client_secret` sent in the request body
`client_secret_basic`: a `client_assertion` sent in the request body and signed using the `client_secret`
`client_secret_basic`: a `client_assertion` sent in the request body and signed by an asymmetric key

anyOf.description: Connect via a map of options

host.description: Name of host to connect to

password.description: Password to be used if the server demands password authentication

port.description: Port number to connect at the server host

socket.description: Directory containing the UNIX socket to connect to

username.description: PostgreSQL user name to connect as

connect_timeout.description: Set the amount of time to attempt connecting to the database

idle_timeout.description: Set a maximum idle duration for individual connections

max_connections.description: Set the maximum number of connections the pool should maintain

max_lifetime.description: Set the maximum lifetime of individual connections

min_connections.description: Set the minimum number of connections the pool should maintain

DiscoveryMode.description: How to discover the provider's configuration

oneOf.description: Use OIDC discovery with strict metadata verification
Use OIDC discovery with relaxed metadata verification
Use a static configuration

DisplaynameImportPreference.description: What should be done for the displayname attribute

template.description:
The Jinja2 template to use for the displayname attribute

If not provided, the default template is `{{ user.name }}`

oneOf.description: Don't send emails anywhere
Send emails via an SMTP relay

password.description: Password for use to authenticate when connecting to the SMTP server

port.description: Port to connect to. Default is 25 for plain, 465 for TLS and 587 for StartTLS

username.description: Username for use to authenticate when connecting to the SMTP server

oneOf.description: Send emails by calling sendmail
Send emails via the AWS SESv2 API

from.description: Email address to use as From when sending emails

reply_to.description: Email address to use as Reply-To when sending emails

EmailImportPreference.description: What should be done with the email attribute

set_email_verification.description: Should the email address be marked as verified

template.description:
The Jinja2 template to use for the email address attribute

If not provided, the default template is `{{ user.email }}`

oneOf.description: Plain text
StartTLS (starts as plain text then upgrade to TLS)
TLS

ExperimentalConfig.description:
Configuration sections for experimental options

Do not change these options unless you know what you are doing.

access_token_ttl.description: Time-to-live of access tokens in seconds. Defaults to 5 minutes.

compat_token_ttl.description: Time-to-live of compatibility access tokens in seconds. Defaults to 5 minutes.

oneOf.description: bcrypt
argon2id
PBKDF2

HttpConfig.description: Configuration related to the web server

issuer.description: OIDC issuer URL. Defaults to `public_base` if not set.

public_base.description: Public URL base from where the authentication service is reachable

trusted_proxies.description: List of trusted reverse proxies that can set the `X-Forwarded-For` header

oneOf.description: Ignore the claim
Suggest the claim value, but allow the user to change it
Force the claim value, but don't fail if it is missing
Force the claim value, and fail if it is missing

JsonWebKeyEcEllipticCurve.description: JSON Web Key EC Elliptic Curve

JsonWebKeyOkpEllipticCurve.description: JSON Web Key OKP Elliptic Curve

anyOf.description: Decrypt content and validate decryption, if applicable
Decrypt key and validate decryption, if applicable
Derive bits not to be used as a key
RSASSA-PSS using SHA-256 and MGF1 with SHA-256
RSASSA-PSS using SHA-384 and MGF1 with SHA-384
RSASSA-PSS using SHA-512 and MGF1 with SHA-512
No digital signature or MAC performed
ECDSA using secp256k1 curve and SHA-256

name.description: A unique name for this listener which will be shown in traces and in metrics labels

prefix.description: HTTP prefix to mount the resources on

tls.description: If set, makes the listener use TLS with the provided certificate and key

LocalpartImportPreference.description: What should be done for the localpart attribute

template.description:
The Jinja2 template to use for the localpart attribute

If not provided, the default template is `{{ user.preferred_username }}`

MatrixConfig.description: Configuration related to the Matrix homeserver

endpoint.description: The base URL of the homeserver's client API

homeserver.description: The server name of the homeserver.

secret.description: Shared secret to use for calls to the admin API

oneOf.description: Don't export metrics
Export metrics to stdout. Only useful for debugging
Export metrics to an OpenTelemetry protocol compatible endpoint
Export metrics via Prometheus. An HTTP listener with the `prometheus` resource must be setup to expose the Promethes metrics.

PkceMethod.description: Whether to use proof key for code exchange (PKCE) when requesting and exchanging the token.

oneOf.description:
Use PKCE if the provider supports it

Defaults to no PKCE if provider discovery is disabled
Always use PKCE with the S256 challenge method
Never use PKCE

authorization_grant_entrypoint.description: Entrypoint to use when evaluating authorization grants

client_registration_entrypoint.description: Entrypoint to use when evaluating client registrations

data.description: Arbitrary data to pass to the policy

email_entrypoint.description: Entrypoint to use when adding an email address

password_entrypoint.description: Entrypoint to use when changing password

register_entrypoint.description: Entrypoint to use when evaluating user registrations

Propagator.description: Propagation format for incoming and outgoing requests

oneOf.description: Propagate according to the W3C Trace Context specification
Propagate according to the W3C Baggage specification
Propagate trace context with Jaeger compatible headers
Propagate trace context with Zipkin compatible headers (single `b3` header variant)
Propagate trace context with Zipkin compatible headers (multiple `x-b3-*` headers variant)

Provider.description: Authentication methods used against the OAuth 2.0 provider

oneOf.description: `none`: No authentication
`client_secret_basic`: `client_id` and `client_secret` used as basic authorization credentials
`client_secret_post`: `client_id` and `client_secret` sent in the request body
`client_secret_basic`: a `client_assertion` sent in the request body and signed using the `client_secret`
`client_secret_basic`: a `client_assertion` sent in the request body and signed by an asymmetric key

authorization_endpoint.description:
The URL to use for the provider's authorization endpoint

Defaults to the `authorization_endpoint` provided through discovery

brand_name.description:
A brand identifier used to customise the UI, e.g. `apple`, `google`, `github`, etc.

Values supported by the default template are:

- `apple` - `google` - `facebook` - `github` - `gitlab` - `twitter`

claims_imports.description: How claims should be imported from the `id_token` provided by the provider

client_id.description: The client ID to use when authenticating with the provider

discovery_mode.description:
How to discover the provider's configuration

Defaults to use OIDC discovery with strict metadata verification

human_name.description: A human-readable name for the provider, that will be shown to users

jwks_uri.description:
The URL to use for getting the provider's public keys

Defaults to the `jwks_uri` provided through discovery

pkce_method.description:
Whether to use proof key for code exchange (PKCE) when requesting and exchanging the token.

Defaults to `auto`, which uses PKCE if the provider supports it.

scope.description: The scopes to request from the provider

token_endpoint.description:
The URL to use for the provider's token endpoint

Defaults to the `token_endpoint` provided through discovery

oneOf.description: Healthcheck endpoint (/health)
Prometheus metrics endpoint (/metrics)
OIDC discovery endpoints
Pages destined to be viewed by humans
GraphQL endpoint
OAuth-related APIs
Matrix compatibility API
Static files

path.description: Path to the directory to serve.

oneOf.description: Mount a "/connection-info" handler which helps debugging informations on the upstream connection

Mount the single page app

This is deprecated and will be removed in a future release.

keys.description: List of private keys to use for signing and encrypting payloads

SentryConfig.description: Configuration related to the Sentry integration

SetEmailVerification.description: Should the email address be marked as verified

oneOf.description: Mark the email address as verified
Don't mark the email address as verified
Mark the email address as verified if the upstream provider says it is through the `email_verified` claim

SubjectImportPreference.description: What should be done for the subject attribute

template.description:
The Jinja2 template to use for the subject attribute

If not provided, the default template is `{{ user.sub }}`

TelemetryConfig.description: Configuration related to sending monitoring data

sentry.description: Configuration related to the Sentry integration

path.description: Path to the folder which holds the templates

TlsConfig.description: Configuration related to TLS on a listener

oneOf.description: Don't export traces
Export traces to the standard output. Only useful for debugging
Export traces to an OpenTelemetry protocol compatible endpoint
Export traces to a Jaeger agent
Thrift over HTTP

endpoint.description:
Full URL of the Jaeger HTTP endpoint

Defaults to `http://localhost:14268/api/traces`

password.description: Password to be used for HTTP basic authentication

username.description: Username to be used for HTTP basic authentication

oneOf.description: Thrift with compact encoding over UDP

agent_host.description:
Hostname of the Jaeger agent

Defaults to `localhost`

agent_port.description:
`udp/thrift.compact` port of the Jaeger agent

Defaults to `6831`

oneOf.description: Export traces to a Zipkin collector

propagators.description: List of propagation formats to use for incoming and outgoing requests

oneOf.description: UNIX domain socket
TCP socket
